snippet: Testimony in the trial of Mr. Silver, the former speaker of the New York Assembly, focused on the extent of his power to approve discretionary financing without accountability.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in corruption trial of New York Assemblyman Sheldon Silver call on Victor E Franco, deputy budget director in Assembly Ways and Means Committee, to illuminate Silver's secretive dealings in state finances; much of Franco's testimony focuses on Silver's power to approve discretionary funding.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Testimony in the trial of Mr. Silver, the former speaker of the New York Assembly, focused on the extent of his power to approve discretionary financing without accountability.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver’s Grants Suppressed in Budget Reports, Official Testifies in Corruption Trial
headline.print_headline: Silver’s Grants Suppressed in Budget Reports, Official Testifies
